MajorClaims.MC1: standardized tests are valuable option for educational system as long as it would help teachers to know if the students are really getting knowledge
MajorClaims.MC2: schools which obligate their students to take standardized tests are right

Claims.C1: these schools can qualitatively check if they are giving an appropriate education to their students
Claims.C3: schools should require students to take standardized tests, as long as this option helps to both sides
Claims.C4: requirement to take standardized tests is the right choice

Premises.P1: exams could be the only way for teachers to see the real abilities of those students
Premises.P2: some students are not so active on the lessons, cause they are already familiar with the issue
Premises.P3: many teachers rely only on the exam results while grading the class
Premises.P4: the usage of standardized tests is the superior option for them
Premises.P5: some students may get used to simply rewriting solved problems from the blackboard
Premises.P6: they will never try to solve problems on their own
Premises.P7: standardized tests offer them such chance
Premises.P8: standardized tests can be good chance for students to apply their knowledge on practice
Premises.P9: in this case teachers can compare the level of knowledge of different students
Premises.P10: In any class there will be students who will show low academic performance, so teachers could work with them more intensively
Premises.P11: standardized tests are required over those who don’t
Premises.P12: if the teacher would know the level of each student he would fairly share his time to all of them
Premises.P13: they help teachers to fairly grade the students
